alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 4:01PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS AFFECTING THE AFTERNOON COMMUTE... At 355 pm, radar indicated a band of snow across east-central Wisconsin. The northern edge of the band extended from near Coloma to Waupaca to Clintonville to Oconto to Egg Harbor. Light to occasionally moderate snow was falling from the band. When combined with temperatures in the mid-20s, the snow was falling hard enough to accumulate on roadways--even those treated with melting agents. In addition, northeast winds gusting from 20 to 30 mph were producing some blowing and drifting of the snow, and further reducing the visibility. The combination of slippery, snow covered roads and reduced visibility was resulting in hazardous travel conditions for the afternoon commute. The snow band is expected to remain in place until early evening, then begin to slowly shift off to the southeast. As a result, the poor travel conditions will persist into tonight. Anyone traveling in east-central Wisconsin during the late afternoon or evening hours should expect to encounter poor driving conditions, plan on a much slower than normal trip, and allow plenty of extra time to reach their destination.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago
